title: The subalgebras of diagonal and scalar matrices
content: According to Wikipedia ("Diagonal Matrix", 8-Dec-2019, ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diagonal_matrix ): "In linear algebra, a _diagonal matrix_ is a matrix in which the entries outside the main diagonal are all zero; the term usually refers to square matrices." The diagonal matrices are mentioned in [Lang] p. 576, but without giving them a dedicated definition. Furthermore, "A diagonal matrix with all its main diagonal entries equal is a _scalar matrix_, that is, a scalar multiple ` la .* I ` of the identity matrix ` I `. Its effect on a vector is scalar multiplication by ` la ` [see ~ scmatscm !]". The scalar multiples of the identity matrix are mentioned in [Lang] p. 504, but without giving them a special name. The main results of this subsection are the definitions of the sets of diagonal and scalar matrices ( ~ df-dmat and ~ df-scmat ), basic properties of (elements of) these sets, and theorems showing that the diagonal matrices are a subring of the ring of square matrices ( ~ dmatsrng ), that the scalar matrices are a subring of the ring of square matrices ( ~ scmatsrng ), that the scalar matrices are a subring of the ring of diagonal matrices ( ~ scmatsrng1 ) and that the ring of scalar matrices (over a commutative ring) is a commutative ring ( ~ scmatcrng ).

blocks.content: Define the set of n x n diagonal (square) matrices over a set (usually a ring) r, see definition in [Roman] p. 4 or Definition 3.12 in [Hefferon] p. 240. (Contributed by AV, 8-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-dmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cdmat, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, crab(s2, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1))), wral(s3, cv(s0), wral(s4, cv(s0), wi(wne(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wceq(co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4)), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-dmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ DMat =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat]s1))| ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s0, ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s0,(s3 ‚â† s4 ‚Üí(s3[s2]s4)=(0 ` s1))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: df-scmat
blocks.content: Define the algebra of n x n scalar matrices over a set (usually a ring) r, see definition in [Connell] p. 57: "A _scalar matrix_ is a diagonal matrix for which all the diagonal terms are equal, i.e., a matrix of the form cI_n". (Contributed by AV, 8-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-scmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cscmat, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, csb(s2, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1)), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), wrex(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s3), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s2)), cfv(cur, cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-scmat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ ScMat =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(s0[Mat]s1)/ s2]{ s3 ‚àà(Base ` s2)| ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà(Base ` s1), s3 =(s4[(√ó ` s2)](1r ` s2)))})
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

thm dmatval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí c3 = { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))})
  ‚ä£ c6 =(c0[Mat]c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c6)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(0 ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c0[DMat]c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c1)
} = {
  syl5eq(c3, { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))}, (c0[DMat]c1), (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  ovmpt2d(hs0, hs1, c0, cdmat, c1, { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))}, cfn, universe, { s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))))}, universe, (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  a1i((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), DMat =(hs0 ‚àà Fin, hs1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))))}))
  df-dmat(hs0, hs1, s0, s1, s2)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1), { s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))))} = { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))})
  rabeqbidv(s0, (Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1)), c4, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1)))), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5))))
  syl6eqr((Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1)), c4, (Base `(c0[Mat]c1)), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1))
  fveq2d(cbs, (hs0[Mat]hs1), (c0[Mat]c1), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1))
  oveq12(hs0, c0, hs1, c1, cmat)
  eqtri(c4, (Base `(c0[Mat]c1)), (Base ` c6))
  fveq2i(cbs, c6, (c0[Mat]c1))
  raleqbidv(s1, hs0, c0, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1), ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))), ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))
  raleqbidv(s2, hs0, c0, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1), (s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1)), (s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5))
  simpl(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c1)
  imbi2d((hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1), s1 ‚â† s2, (s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1), (s1[s0]s2)= c5)
  eqeq2d((s1[s0]s2), (0 ` hs1), c5, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1))

  elex(c1, c2)
  mp1i((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), { s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))} ‚àà ùïå, c4 ‚àà ùïå)

  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, (hs0[Mat]hs1))
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, hs0, cmat, hs1)
  diff.cmat.s(s0)

  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s2, hs0 = c0, hs1 = c1)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)

blocks.content: A ` N ` x ` N ` diagonal matrix over (a ring) ` R ` . (Contributed by AV, 18-Dec-2019.)

thm dmatel(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wb(wcel(c3, c4), wa(wcel(c3, c5), wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c6)))))))
  -| wceq(c7, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c7))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c0, cdmat, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

blocks.name: dmatsubcl
blocks.content: The difference of two diagonal matrices is a diagonal matrix. (Contributed by AV, 19-Aug-2019.) (Revised by AV, 18-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

  mpbir2and(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))), wcel(co(c2, cfv(csg, c5), c4), c3), wcel(co(c2, cfv(csg, c5), c4), c6), wral(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wi(wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfv(csg, c5), c4), cv(hs1)), c7)))))

} = {

blocks.name: scmatscmiddistr
blocks.content: Distributive law for scalar and ring multiplication for scalar matrices expressed as multiplications of a scalar with the identity matrix. (Contributed by AV, 19-Dec-2019.)

blocks.content: The identity matrix is a scalar matrix. (Contributed by AV, 20-Aug-2019.) (Revised by AV, 18-Dec-2019.)

} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cfv(cur, c2), c3)), wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c1)))

blocks.name: scmatsubcl
blocks.content: The difference of two scalar matrices is a scalar matrix. (Contributed by AV, 20-Aug-2019.) (Revised by AV, 19-Dec-2019.)

  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c1)

  ‚ä£ c7 =(√ó ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶(s0[c7]c6))

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)

  mpd(((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c4), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c3, hs0 =(c2 ` hs1)), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c3, hs0 =(hs1[c7]c6)))
  3expa(c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Ring, hs0 ‚àà c4, ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c3, hs0 =(hs1[c7]c6)))

  eqcomd((hs1[c7]c6), (c2 ` hs1), ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring)‚àß hs1 ‚àà c3))
  adantll(c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Ring, hs1 ‚àà c3, (c2 ` hs1)=(hs1[c7]c6))

blocks.content: There is a 1-1 function from a ring to any ring of scalar matrices with positive dimension over this ring. (Contributed by AV, 25-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: scmatmhm
blocks.content: There is a monoid homomorphism from the multiplicative group of a ring to the multiplicative group of the ring of scalar matrices over this ring. (Contributed by AV, 29-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: mat1scmat
blocks.content: A 1-dimensional matrix over a ring is always a scalar matrix (and therefore, by ~ scmatdmat , also a diagonal matrix). (Contributed by AV, 21-Dec-2019.)
